title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.2: MATERNAL & NEWBORN HEALTH

description.narrative: MoH has increased capacity to deliver high-impact reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health interventions., which contributes to Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2024, more children, adolescents and mothers benefit from quality health interventions, including in emergency situations.

sector.narrative: Childhood disease specific interventions (Pneumonia, Diarrhoea, Tuberculosis)
Community and home based maternal and newborn care
HIV Prevention programs for adolescents, including key populations; including for condom programming, VMMC, harm reduction, PreP and sexuality education
HIV service access and quality improvement through system strengthening at facility and community levels
Implementation of community based integrated prevention and management of childhood illnesses (e.g. iCCM)
Maternal and newborn care policy advocacy, evidence generation, national / subnational capacity development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: MoH has increased capacity to deliver high-impact reproductive, maternal, newborn, child and adolescent health interventions.

description.narrative: In 2021, 405,720;diarrhoea cases (83,6%) and;556,122;pneumonia cases (90,4%) were treated at 2,097 community care sites and health facilities in 128 HZ.;354,772;IMCI kits for diarrhoea treatment and fever;were distributed to children under five and;36,221;pregnant women received delivery kits for safer childbirths in;29;HZ.;Thanks to the mentorship program,;maternal and neonatal mortality rates declined respectively from 283 in 2019 to 208 deaths per 100,000 live births in 2020 and from 9.7 to 8.9 deaths per 1,000 live births in the same period,;as well as an improvement in medicines availability.;; | Status:On-track | As-of Date:27/12/2021
